fields.summary: Plan label overlaps the description in Filter projects dialog

fields.description:
The screen should stay where it was so I can resume reading the plans.
Now I have to re-read the whole list to find the place where the newly loaded plans start.

I refer to All builds page
fields.summary: When I click "Show more plans" the page scrolls to the top

fields.description:
Currently, only users with admin global permissions and users that are part of the "bamboo-admin" group are able to use the "Clear error from logs" option in the build result summary page. It should be possible for plan administrators to use this feature too.  it is not convenient to contact an admin to remove these errors every time they get populated.

Can this be part of the "Edit" permission that should be selected if the admin checkbox is checked?
fields.summary: A plan admin should be able to clear errors from build result summary

fields.description:
Hi
I am trying to setup a build configuration for my visual studio 2010 professional project. The visual platform we are using is "x64".
"x64" is not present in the dropdwon list to choose platform in the task settings.

How can i set my visual studio build correctly?
fields.summary: Visual Studio Configuration

fields.description:
It appears that Bamboo branch plans cannot have different requirements to the master plan and this is how we specify which agent the plan is to be run by.
So a Branch Plan will always run on the same agents as the Master Plan.
To get around this I will need to create a new plan for the 2.1 branch on which I can change the requirements and remove the existing branch plan.
Can I get permission to add Plans to Bamboo please ?

The disadvantage of this is the settings of the main branch plan won't be inherited, but new plans can be created based on the main branch plan.
These are not such big disadvantages and I don't think there is a way around the  agent requirements issue.
fields.summary: Using different agents for different branches

fields.description:
Bamboo OnDemand (I don't check if the mainstream version presents this bug too) isn't checking the correct spelling of JIRA groups.

Example:

Set group:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/93615/Screen%20Shot%202013-06-06%20at%204.36.12%20PM.png!


Correct group name spelling:


!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/93616/Screen%20Shot%202013-06-06%20at%204.36.58%20PM.png!

With this error, users from that group aren't able to run the build.
fields.summary: Bamboo isn't checking the correct spelling of group names on Plan permissions.

fields.description:
When granting plan permissions to group, instead of retrieve group names from JIRA, Bamboo presents a blank field to be filled by customer. This option could drive customers to simple to solve errors, like misplaced uppercase letters or even wrong group names. 
Get this data directly from JIRA, presenting a dropdown menu or other way to select the existant groups could dismiss the error possibility.
fields.summary: Retrive JIRA groups data to give Access Permission to Bamboo Plan instead of make this option editable by cutomers.
Bamoo doesn't trigger a plan if "Anonymous Users" access is unchecked
REST API docs say only HTTP GET is supported, but there are resources that support POST

fields.summary: AbstractMethodError cloning a plan

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Create application between JIRA and Bamboo server as illustrated in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Bamboo
# Configured the Jira project with the permissions Browse Project and View Version Control to Group (Anyone) so that anonymous (not logged in) users can view the project, and view released versions. 
# Configured the Bamboo project with the permission View set to Anonymous Users.
# Login to JIRA and view a released version, the Builds tab correctly displays relevant builds from Bamboo including the details. 
# Now logout of JIRA and try to view the same release tab related to that project and you will get an error "An error occurred while trying to retrieve the build information".

*Note*: Accessing Bamboo anonymously shows the build information which JIRA is restricting.
fields.summary: Anonymous view of the Build release tab does not show build details but rather throws errors.

fields.description:
When following the "instant messaging server" in https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/admin/administer.action we get a 500 HTTP ERROR.

User reported this in https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/BUILDENG-3521
fields.summary: Broken link to "instant messaging server" in the Bamboo Administration home page

fields.summary: cannot stop a build

fields.description: Starting with JIRA 6.1, JIRA will support numbers and underscores in the project key pattern. Bamboo does not currently support this and will need to for happy integration with JIRA.
fields.summary: Support JIRA's expanded Project Key Patterns

fields.description: When watching the wallboard, I would like to have a clearer indication when a plan is building. The "rotating wheel" is hardly visible from further away. The easiest way would be to change the background color of this plan to blue during the build (like in the build view) instead of leaving it at green or red.
fields.summary: Change color on wallboard when building a plan

fields.description:
For every release, it should be possible to see the complete history of that bundle.

Events should also include when/who/what for any event.

Events include:
* created
* deployed
* replaced
* marked as broken
* unmarked as broken
* marked as approved
* unmarked as approved
* commented
* comment deleted
fields.summary: Deployment release history
Deployment status on JIRA issue

fields.description:
Umbrella ticket for plugin extensions for deployment projects.

*Action menus*
* Deployment project dashboard
* Deployment project
* Deployment environment
* Deployment release
* Deployment result

*Tabs*
* Deployment project dashboard
* Deployment project
* Deployment environment
* Deployment release
* Deployment result

*Web panels*
* Version page
* Deployment preview

*Pre/post actions*
* Before the version is deployed
** Should be able to prevent the deployment from occurring and provide a good error message
** Should be able to run special actions if the deployment is a "rollback"
* After the version is deployed
fields.summary: Plugin extensions for deployment projects

fields.description:
The exiting checkout task in deployment environments only updates to the latest revision of the repository, which may not work for all situations.

Bamboo should provide an option to checkout to the revision that was used in the build result that is linked to the version that is currently being deployed. 

This would keep the source code in sync across build and deploy.
fields.summary: Deployment environment checkout task should use same revision as build result

fields.description:
To find which task has failed, a user must go looking in the build or deployment log.

Bamboo should provide a list of tasks on build and deployment results that makes it easy to visualise which task failed and provide a shortcut to the relevant logs to aid failure investigation.
fields.summary: Visualisation of task execution

fields.description: The JIRA Release Management plugin only supports builds but not deployment projects at this time.
fields.summary: Update JIRA Release Management to support deployment projects

fields.description:
It is not possible to report on smoke test failures when a set of smoke tests (selenium, etc) are executed as part of the environments task lists.

We should add reporting around the deployment result to record and track smoke test failures.
fields.summary: Smoke testing reports in deployment environments

fields.description: Provide a new trigger for a environment to trigger a deployment when another environment has finished deploying successfully
fields.summary: Trigger another environment on a successful deployment

fields.description: There should be a wallboard that displays the latest status of a deployment project suitable for display on a TV screen or large monitor.
fields.summary: Deployment project wallboard

fields.description: When a deployment project is updated, we should provide an entry in the audit log to show what was changed and who changed it.
fields.summary: Configuration audit log for deployment projects

fields.description: Users should be able to favourite deployment projects and their environments. When marked as a favourite, the status should appear within My Bamboo.
fields.summary: My Bamboo and favourites for deployment projects and environments

fields.description: When a release is deployed, any issue incorporated in the version should have its watchers sent an email notification so that they are aware that it has been deployed somewhere.
fields.summary: Send notification to all issue watchers when the issue has been deployed

fields.description: SCP task was updated to understand the available artifacts intrinsically. This update should also be applied to the Tomcat task.
fields.summary: Make Tomcat task aware of artifacts

fields.description:
Provide a way to easily copy or clone tasks from one environment or another.

There is no easy way to clone or copy tasks from one deployment environment to another, which can make setting up environments that have the same tasks tedious.
fields.summary: Task management for deployment environments

fields.description:
Deployment projects cannot currently be linked to deployment projects. 

Some users may also want to deploy branches to certain environments for QA and testing purposes.

If you watch or vote for this ticket, please leave a comment that explains your workflow.
fields.summary: Support plan branches with deployment projects

fields.description: Do not allow the release to be deployed if it has been marked as broken.
fields.summary: Disallow deployment of release if it is broken

fields.description: Only allow users who belong to a specified group be able to mark a deployment release as approved or broken
fields.summary: Restrict release approvers to a group of users

fields.description: Individual environments within a deployment project can have notifications but the deployment project has no way to define them at its level.
fields.summary: Notifications for Deployment projects
Notification for when a deployment release has been marked as broken or approved

fields.description: When a deployment release is commented on by a user, it should be possible to receive a notification for the comment.
fields.summary: Deployment release comment notification

fields.description: In configuration of shared repositories, or plan repositories, it would be nice to have a "test repository" button such as in Fisheye to test that connection to the SCM server can be established, that login is possible and retrieval of the repo is successful (including submodule checkout in Git).
fields.summary: Test repository configuration in Source Repository configuration

fields.description:
On several occasions, I needed to pass a Powershell script some kind of a runtime variable that contained only the plan name.

I see there's the ${bamboo.buildPlanName} variable, but it includes project, plan, and job names. I find this variable name confusing and I'm hesitant to regex out only the parts I need.

It will be helpful to have all three in separate variables.
fields.summary: Add runtime variables for project name and plan name

# In the plan's branch configuration, add more than 6 branches (e.g. mybranch00 to mybranch10).
# Delete the plan.

Workaround: Refresh the error page / re-try the delete operation (multiple times if necessary) until the delete succeeds. It seems to delete a certain number of branches each time until it's done.

The error message:
{noformat}
java.sql.SQLException: MaxOpenPreparedStatements limit reached
{noformat}
suggests that it could be related to BAM-11642.

The following suggests that the method being employed to delete the branches is exhausting the database connection pool: 
{noformat}
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: Pool exhausted
{noformat}

Bamboo OnDemand's database configuration is found at {{/service/j2ee_bamboo/catalina-base/conf/Catalina/localhost/builds.xml}}:
{code:xml}
  <Resource name="jdbc/DefaultDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
            ...
            driverClassName="org.postgresql.Driver"
            url="jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/bamboo"
            ...
            initialSize="2"
            minIdle="2"
            maxActive="${MAX_ACTIVE_DB_CONNECTIONS}"
            maxIdle="4"
            maxWait="120000"
            poolPreparedStatements="true"
            maxOpenPreparedStatements="30"
            timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis="300000"
            testOnBorrow="false"
            testWhileIdle="true"
            numTestsPerEvictionRun="3"
            minEvictableIdleTimeMillis="600000"
          />
{code}

And {{MAX_ACTIVE_DB_CONNECTIONS}} is found at {{/service/j2ee_bamboo/env/MAX_ACTIVE_DB_CONNECTIONS}} and is set to 25.

The task should have a provision to accept Commit message during tagging.

fields.description:
When we have Bamboo integrated with JIRA, the build status in JIRA shows only the green check (successful) and the red exclamation (failure) icons. But if we have a different status, such as a manual stage, it's not showing the right icon in JIRA, only in Bamboo (in this case, the green circle).

It would be great if we have the same status icons in both tools.

fields.description:
For mercurial repositories that support and have largefiles, Bamboo is not able to clone them to the working directory. The only way to make this work is to create a local copy of the repo on the Bamboo server by cloning using a command line. This will cache the largefiles to the temp location at {{C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\largefiles}} where Bamboo is able to grab them later.

If these system cache are empty, Bamboo is not able to get them and returns with messages like below where it mentioned clearly that 0 largefiles where updated or removed :

{noformat}
24-May-2013 22:54:02	resolving manifests
24-May-2013 22:54:02	 overwrite: True, partial: False
24-May-2013 22:54:02	 ancestor: 22b48d3b78cd+, local: 22b48d3b78cd+, remote: 22b48d3b78cd
24-May-2013 22:54:02	0 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved
24-May-2013 22:54:02	getting changed largefiles
24-May-2013 22:54:02	getting largefiles: 0/3 lfile (0.00%)
24-May-2013 22:54:02	getting second.txt:da39a3ee5e6b4b0d3255bfef95601890afd80709
24-May-2013 22:54:02	getting largefiles: 1/3 lfile (33.33%)
24-May-2013 22:54:02	getting large file.txt:419c5eb76d045721dae2647e3d7a5ba7ea00b811
24-May-2013 22:54:02	getting largefiles: 2/3 lfile (66.67%)
24-May-2013 22:54:02	getting hgrc.txt:da39a3ee5e6b4b0d3255bfef95601890afd80709
24-May-2013 22:54:02	0 largefiles updated, 0 removed
24-May-2013 22:54:02	Updated source code to revision: 22b48d3b78cd4741738876b67a7e3e9484fa1afd
{noformat}

With the largefiles cached in the system directory, we see something like:
{noformat}
24-May-2013 22:57:30	resolving manifests
24-May-2013 22:57:30	 overwrite: True, partial: False
24-May-2013 22:57:30	 ancestor: 22b48d3b78cd+, local: 22b48d3b78cd+, remote: a1d49d4ec133

fields.description:
Configure a plan with automatic plan branching that runs a shell script and checks for non-zero exit status.

Create a branch and modify the shell script to fail (breaking the build). Push the branch. Bamboo will automatically create a plan branch for the branch and it will fail.

Expected: Send an email to the committer notifying them of the failure.

Actual: Bamboo says that the plan branch has "no changes" because this is the first build of the plan branch, so there are no committers, so nobody gets an email.

This is particularly bad for short-lived Gatekeeper bug branches, where there's intended to be only one commit on the branch before Gatekeeper builds it and merges it into master. These Gatekeeper builds send no emails at all.
fields.summary: Automatic plan branches don't send emails on first build

fields.description:
I would like for Bamboo to have the ability to Bulk Edit All Plans with their branches, so that I can update the SSH Key all at once, instead of having to manually go into each plan and each branch to do this.

This process alone already takes me close to 5 hours given we have many builds and branches, so if there's an easier way to update SSH keys for all plans/branches that would be great.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit Plans with Branches to Update SSH Key all at once

fields.summary: Cannot save cloned job

fields.description:
Hi,

I have configured my git repository with SSH-key authentication. My repository has a reference to a submodule, so I have checked the "Use submodules" flag in the checkout task configuration.
The .gitmodule config does not have a username set in the URL:
[submodule "submodule/sub1"]
	path = submodule/sub1
	url = ssh://xxxx/git/xxxxxxxxx

When bamboo runs the ""C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\bin\git.exe"  submodule update --init --recursive" command, my build hangs at the log output:

21-May-2013 18:42:14	Submodule 'submodule/sub1' (ssh://xxxxx/git/xxx/xxx) registered for path 'submodule/sub1'
21-May-2013 18:42:15	Cloning into 'submodule/sub1'...

Even a "stop currently running build" does not stop the build.
21-May-2013 19:00:33	Request to stop 'XXXXXXXXX' received from xxxxxxxx

I have to kill the agent process in order to stop the build.

I have downloaded the newest git version (https://code.google.com/p/msysgit/downloads/list?can=3&q=official+Git) described here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Git
I have created a Git capability pointing to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\bin\git.exe".

Maybe git is hanging at a password prompt?
Why does it not hand over the ssh authentication properly?

Any advice?
Thanks,
Martin
fields.summary: Git Submodule checkout hanging

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * create a project with a stage and two jobs; 
 ** use some simple code with a JUnit test, run tests
 ** both jobs can run the same goals (e.g. clean test)
 * enable 'automatically integrate clover into this build' for JobA; do not do this for JobB
 * run the build, go to the build summary page

What happens now:
1. Click on JobA, click "Clover tab". You will see a report like this:

!job1_clover.png!

and the URL is like this:
http://localhost:8085/build/result/viewCloverResult.action?buildKey=CCD-CMA-JOB1&buildNumber=9

2. Click on a JobB. The page does not refresh and we still see JobA. BUG!

3. Click on a JobB again. Now page reloads and we see sth like this:

!jobb_clover_no_coverage.png!

Note that URL shows 'viewCloverResult.action'. I'm not sure whether it's a bug (because the Clover tab is not visible on the list)  - maybe it should switch to the first tab? Or it's a feature, i.e. Bamboo shall preserve the active tab, even if data is not available? It's up to you, Bamboo Team!



References:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/170680/clover-select-box-showing-multiple-scans-jobs-and-i-want-1
fields.summary: Page refresh problem when switching between Jobs on a Build Summary page

fields.description:
When switching build tools used in the project, you're classically forced to update all your build jobs (sometimes on different instances) to allow new building of the project.

It would be great to have:
* a standard file (xml based) you might export a job definition and commit it to your repository
** shouuld be aware of per-job customizable extensions / configurations

and / or
* to get extraordinary notifications on a build fail when new build tool files are aquired and detected (e.g. composer.json (composer), build.xml (ant), pom.xml (mvn / maven), config.rb (compass / SCSS))
** a server option to allow "auto-healing" when a build jobs fails AND new build files are detected
*** i.e. auto-add composer, ant or maven tasks to the job and retry build
*** revert task changes if build still fails => forces developer to update job definition (via XML, see improvement description above)

This would be a great benefit and would save a lot of developer time in most cases I think, even in agile projects where you aren't settled down fix to a special project layout in common.
Also sometimes it is needed to enhance the project with other build tools (using composer for "the web thingy" but still bundle and build the java application as WAR via maven). You don't have to add special maven extensions that will complicate setup and knowlegdge about how to trigger / include the "second builder".
fields.summary: build tools (e.g. Composer) aware auto-healing of Jobs

fields.description:
The Bamboo dashboard presents an exhaustive list of all the builds that the instance has registered. This is useful for an overview of all the plans available running. But one of the things I find myself doing over and over again is locating the plans I know should be running on my feature branch, clicking the "branches" icon next to them, locating my branch and then opening that in a new tab.

It would save me almost 10 minutes of my life per day if there were alternate views in to the dashboard. Namely:

* Browse by project + plan
* Browse by repo + branch
* Browse by favourite
* Browse by failing builds where I'm potentially responsible

Between these views, I'd be able to bounce around Bamboo and do everything I need to without ever having to work too hard to get the info I need.
fields.summary: Browse Builds by repo+branch

fields.description:
See problem described here: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOVERKB/Multi-module+Maven+build+on+Bamboo+with+Clover+history+reports 

Bamboo uses default '-Dmaven.clover.historyDir=.cloverhistory' location, which is relative and build fails for sub-modules. Users are not able to override this setting (if they define the property in 'Goals' field in 'Maven Task' configuration, the mvn command is executed with two options - one from user and one from Bamboo). 

Instead of this Bamboo shall explicitly use the absolute path pointing to a workspace root, e.g.:

{noformat}
-Dmaven.clover.historyDir=${bamboo.build.working.directory}/.cloverhistory
{noformat}

Affects all Bamboo versions.
fields.summary: Use an absolute path for Clover history dir for automatic Clover integration

fields.description:
Currently, it's planned to deliver the feature in two steps:
 * Bamboo 5.8 - changes in Bamboo Clover Plugin UI
 * Bamboo 5.9 - enabling this feature by upgrading dependency to Clover 4.0.3+

*Problem:*
A build can fail during test execution in case when Automatic Clover integration is used and the project is a Maven project with multiple modules having dependencies between each other. 

Scenario:
{noformat}
MasterModule
  /ModuleA
  /ModuleB
{noformat}

Maven goal is called: clean test. Compilation order will be:

{noformat}
MasterModule clean
MasterModule test
ModuleB clean
ModuleB test
ModuleB jar <-- JAR is created
ModuleA clean
ModuleA test  <-- using ModuleB.jar in classpath 
{noformat}

What happens when Automatic Clover integration is enabled? Goals are enhanced as follows: clean test clean clover2:setup verify clover2:aggregate clover2:clover. What happens? A compilation is as follows:

{noformat}
ModuleB clean
ModuleB test
ModuleB clean
ModuleB clover2:setup
ModuleB verify
ModuleB jar <-- JAR is created with instrumented classes!
ModuleA clean
ModuleA test  <-- using ModuleB.jar in classpath with instrumented classes, but we're before clover2:setup so clover.jar artifact is not available, build fails
//expected to have ModuleA clover2:setup verify ...
{noformat}


Issue affects all Bamboo versions.


*Possible improvement:*

1) Analyze which goals are defined in Maven task. Next add Clover goals in between:

 * add "clover2:setup" after the "clean" (if present) and before other goals
 ** but "jaxb2:generate clover2:setup"
 ** but "wsdl2java clover2:setup" (?)

 * what to do in case when "install" or "deploy" phase is declared? deploying instrumented JARs shall be avoided in general
 ** write help for "automatically integrate clover" radio button?
 ** write warning in UI if such goals are found?
 ** write warning in a build log if such goals are found?

 * add "clover2:aggregate clover2:clover" after all goals

2) Alternatively, call Clover first and clean everything after Clover finishes, e.g. something like:

{noformat}
mvn clean clover2:setup verify clover2:clover clean <original goals>
{noformat}

but this causes a problem that all Clover reports will be wiped out after last clean. They'd have to be stored somewhere. 

3) Alternatively, we could add an extra Maven task at the end of the Job with would run "clean" + Clover goals. But this would change build configuration.
fields.summary: Improve Automatic Clover integration for multi-module maven builds

This is a bug and a display issue in Bamboo. 
The revisions hash is showing up randomly in the build result summary page.
This problem is experienced mostly when a plan is linked to more than 40 repositories.
Check the attached screenshot as an example, the plan is connected to almost 40 Stash repositories and the hash is only showing up for some of them.
*  Though we were thinking that the hash is only missing for those that are not updated for a while, it's completely unrelated and shows up randomly regardless of whether that specific repository is being updated recently or not.

fields.description:
In my 4.4.5 instance, I have two Stages, the default stage and a TestStage.
Under the "default stage" I have the following jobs:
1. AJob
2. bJob
3. ZJob

And under the "TestStage" I have:
1. BBJob
2. CJob
3. TheTestJob

Please see OrderOfJobs_1.png.

All the jobs under each stage get sorted alphabetically, Non-case sensitive and regardless of the order they are created. Being able to drag/drop and move them, it's expected to be able to move a job within a stage, but it's not possible.  However, I'm able to move the jobs from one stage to the other stage, when doing this, the order is lost, ex. I moved the "TheTestJob" from the  "TestStage" to the "default stage" and the job list was not in alphabetical order until I refreshed the page (Please see OrderOfJobs_2.png). I experienced the same behavior when I moved this job back to the  "TestStage". (Please see OrderOfJobs_3.png).

1. If it's not possible to move the jobs within a stage, or if the only way for re-ordering them is by re-naming them, this needs to be mentioned or documented somewhere. If moving the job within a stage should be possible, please fix this problem.

2. Please make the ordering when moving a job to a different stage  happen right away without the need to refresh the browser.
fields.summary: Improve/Fix the order of the jobs in stages

fields.description:
There is a global Build Monitoring section in which properties such as "log quiet time" and such are configured.  It is possible to also override this configuration at the job level.

It would be nice if it were possible to have a middle-ground at which this configuration could be controlled.  For example, it might be appropriate for jobs within the same project to use a similar configuration.

Would it be possible to override the global build monitoring configuration at the project level, so that it applies to all applicable jobs in plans within that project?
fields.summary: Provide means by which build monitoring configuration can be applied at the project and (possibly) plan levels

fields.description:
If the agent's IP address changes, perhaps because DHCP is being used, then you will have to reapprove the agent when it next tries to connect using that different IP address. One way we can overcome this issue is to use the ipv6 for authentication which is dos not change. While this is good, the bottleneck is that we have to install the agent itself using ipv6 before that could be achieved.

It will be nice if we can force Bamboo to accept the ipv6 for authentication even if we are using the ipv4.
fields.summary: Allow remote agent authentication using ipv6 eventhough the agent is installed using ipv4

fields.description:
In the deploy tomcat application configuration, the field *WAR File* has to point to an actual war file or else it fails. The wordings at the moment is misleading as it suggests that path is enough. This is the present description there:

bq.The path of the WAR to deploy relative to the working directory
fields.summary: Correct the wordings of war file location configuration in the tomcat deployer

fields.description:
At the moment, the war file parameter has to be added in such a way that it points to the actual war file. Pointing to the directory does not work and fails with errors like:
{code}
Could not find war file at D:\atlassian\BAMBOO\atlassian-bamboo-4.4.5\HOME\xml-data\build-dir\TESTA-TOMCAT2-JOB1\target. The application could not be deployed.
{code}

It will be nice if it can calculate and identify the war file itself. This is quite important as sometimes the war file names are quite dynamic

*Workaround*
The workaround you can adopt at the moment since the configurator accepts variables will be to use [bamboo build variables|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using+global,+plan+or+build-specific+variables] in your pom.xml so that the war files have a standard pattern and then use same variable in your tomcat config
fields.summary: Tomcat deployer should be able to accept the path of war file

fields.description:
Currently the Artifact Size Limit per build in Bamboo OnDemand is set to 1GB and it cannot be changed, that limitation can be a problem for a number of users who have larger artifacts, making Bamboo OnDemand not a viable option for them. 

That could be changed if an option was added in the UI allowing users to set the artifact size limit per build.
fields.summary: Allow users to set Artifact Size Limit per build in Bamboo OnDemand
Change BUILD_SUCCESSFUL_MARKER et al. to allow patterns in build task plugins

fields.description: When you give a not-logged-in coworker a link to an artifact on Bamboo, rather than giving the option to login, it sends back a misleading error message.
fields.summary: Bamboo artifact link broken when user not logged in

fields.description: Currently Bamboo appends the new logs of a reran build (when using the Run -> "Rerun this Build" feature) to the main logs only when the previous build failed. Please do the same for a previously successful builds or at least add a feature so that a user can choose whether to keep the previous logs or not before rerunning the same plan.
fields.summary: Append the logs of a previously successful build to the main build logs

fields.description:
In the repository configuration in Bamboo, users have the option to only choose a single branch and then later use the branching feature to add branches which are created as branch plans that are independent of each other.

It will be nice to have a single plan that can clone all the branches as a single entity in the working directory
fields.summary: Provide the functionality to add multiple branches to repository configuration

fields.description:
Hello,

I am having an SDK issue as described here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/159722/nullpointer-when-retrieving-files-from-commitcontext

I was told at the support Jira that I should log it here. Since it seems to be a reproduce-able issue which only occurs after an upgrade to a higher version I was hoping to get this fixed by logging it.

This is causing some problems on our end since this error fails a number of our plans for a while now, the developers are getting restless .
thanks

jan

fields.description: When the window is narrow enough (less than ~1780 pixels for me), the announcement banner gets covered by some of the header elements. See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Announcement banner covered by header elements

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Since 4.4 the rest endpoints were mostly switched to using the cache.  However, whenever we serve a plan we provide basic permissions information.   To get this information we need to load the plan from the database anyway.  On large instances, this is a lot of plans to load and is too slow, causing gadgets to time out before showing anything

On JIRA, this can cause the Bamboo Release Plugin to error out with "JIRA is having difficulty contacting <Bamboo Instance>. If this problem persists, contact your JIRA administrators. You can still release this version in JIRA without triggering a build."

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access an endpoint such as http://localhost:8085/bamboo/rest/api/latest/project.json?expand=projects.project.plans.plan&max-results=1000.

h3. Expected Results

It returns within a reasonable timeframe.

h3. Actual Results

It can take over 40s to return.

h3. Notes

This can cause timeouts for the JIRA Bamboo Release Plugin.
fields.summary: Performance Issues with REST project end-point (gadgets dont load)
